pullRequest.title: Build dependency graph for verbose tree

commit.message: dependencyTree txt added to reference in chat
close to complete tree serializer but line beginnings not correct
cleaning code and adding scope to labels and tests
added optional dependency message and test
verboseTree test passing but shouldn't be
Test added and running as expected
remove dependency plugin and stub utils
Integration test skeleton not machine dependent
Seems to work to build graph but fails integration test when using serializer

nodes.bodyText: change this to a more specific exception
you should almost never have to catch a generic Exception. See Chapter 10 of Effective Java.
DependencyResolutionException is probably what you need here
try not to include commented code in PRs. It all needs to be removed or uncommented before this can be merged.
Let's try and get the locally specific paths out of this PR.

commit.message: trying to use previous graphBuilder code
No compile errors with dependencies\graphBuilder code but classNotFoundException
test build log added for easy sharing
test running with new code added but little new code execution
Test failing because the graph is not being built properly
bug with no dependencies in tree-verbose, no bug in tree-verbose2
fixed bug with null dependencyNode being returned as root

commit.message: Ignore test dependencies that are not declared in pom.xml - serializer unit tests broken
junit is shown as compile dependency even when scoped with test
attempting to fix issue with scopes
fixed test issue, need to add better tests
scope issue fixed, need to change serializer from dfs to bfs and add management messages
BFS conflict logic added; tests need to be fixed and code cleaned
code cleaned up, need to add functionality for creating a cycle containing graph and dependency management support

nodes.bodyText: Why is this a field? Looks like it could be a local variable.
This object can't be used in parallel, correct? Worth documenting.
Is the slash change enough? Do you need to use the canonicalization in Files? Drive letters?
Is zip really the only possible wrong thing?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,48 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2019 Google LLC.
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package org.apache.maven.dependency.graph;
+
+import org.eclipse.aether.artifact.Artifact;
+import org.eclipse.aether.collection.DependencyCollectionContext;
+import org.eclipse.aether.collection.DependencySelector;
+import org.eclipse.aether.graph.Dependency;
+
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * Excludes artifacts with {@code zip} type.
+ */
+public final class FilteringZipDependencySelector implements DependencySelector
+{
+    // To exclude log4j-api-java9:zip:2.11.1, which is not published.
+    // https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/cloud-opensource-java/issues/339
+
+    @Override
+    public boolean selectDependency( Dependency dependency )
+    {
+        Artifact artifact = dependency.getArtifact();
+        Map<String, String> properties = artifact.getProperties();
+        // Because LinkageChecker only checks jar file, zip files are not needed
+        return !"zip".equals( properties.get( "type" ) );

nodes.bodyText: I'm surprised that this isn't somewhere you could pull it in from, but I can't tell you where to get it from.

commit.message: serializeGraph methods made static and class made final
map changed to set in serializeGraph
rootNode now a local variable instead of field in buildDepGraph
